reviewText:
This game is amazing. Most police games usually just have you shoot people but this game is what I look for in a police game. Driving around a city looking for speeders or drunk people then you get a real crime you have to go and arrest or save.

Pros: Police based gameplay such as compliance, tazers, etc.
Crimes that can turn deadly in a few seconds.
Drugs and evidence can be taken.
Ranking systems and vehicle searches.
Open world and many capabilities.
Health needs to be maintained, hunger and energy do as well from sleeping or eating while stress can be managed by sleeping or going out with friends/family.

Cons: Is a tad glitchy and the AI isnt the smartest bunch i have seen.
Cop car goes from 0 to 100 in 2 seconds for some reason.
Police car is like paper, it gets hurt from tapping bumpers a tiny bit.
Enemy threats arent very threatening when they have to debate to shoot you.

Needed: Maybe fellow police AI.
Maybe a more SWAT style based missions such as hostage situations.
Needs multiplayer to play with buddies.
Home searches for weapons or drugs.
Real shootouts or bank robberys.

All in all this game is a great fun game to play once and a while and I had a lot of fun with it despite its short comings.

reviewText: This is a well put together game. I love playing it everyday and all day if i had the time. I like the concept of the game and how you can pretty much do what you want. I would like to see a spot light added to the game. I also wish you can detain the subject your dealing with in your vehicle until your done investigating making the decision if your going to place them under arrest or let them go. Im very big on the lights n i love what they have done so far but i will like to see the LED lights reflect off the buildings and other nearby objects from like a block radius because when i turn on my lights i like for people to now im in the area from miles away just on how bright my lights are reflecting off of other objects. I also would like to see more graphics especially in the city. My biggest dislike is the handling of the vehicle, it never stops in time and turns are too aggressive i just wish it was more realistic on the stops because i also crash into something because it takes forever to stop no matter how fast are slow your traveling. I also want to be able to use the computer in the vehicle to run ID's and driver's license. Although im waiting to see all of these things happen this is the best police simulator game I ever played, this game is going to make history.

reviewText:
One of my first days on the job I got shot to death by a senior citizen peddling prescription drugs.

So lets get to it. If you have waited a long time like I have for a game like this to come along. I would grab this on sale at probably half off if you are looking for a police simulator because it is worth it if you can look past it's issues. But I don't think it is worth the full price. Mainly due to the bugs.

You will have some days on Duty where tons of action occurs. As soon as your day starts you get to a simple task like perform traffic stops, or road blocks and check drivers for vehicle problems, such as invalid license plates and drunken drivers. Or simple tasks such as ticketing illegally parked vehicles.

Other days you will get calls about robberies, injured people, people assisting in homicides. The game does have a customization menu for your vehicle and you can buy new weapons as well which is a nice feature however it is rather limited. You also do get promotions and paid more money with those promotions to buy new cars, customize them and also decorate your home.

You have 3 meters on your screen you need to keep track of.

-Energy (You need sleep)
-Hunger
-Stress (You reduce this by watching TV, showering, or hanging with family or friends on your time off)

The games major downfalls come in its outdated graphics as well as bugs. The AI can be very buggy at times and all over the place, also some of the options do not work so well. Such as obtaining a search warrant, I cannot seem to get this to work for the life of me.

All in all a great game, but it feels unfinished, it plays like it's early access and I wish there was a wider variety of jobs to perform besides ticketing, injured people, drunken drivers and fleeing criminals. I would love for the developers to bring new content to this game and address the issues with the bugs.

All in all I like the game game but I would NOT pick this up at full price. Wait for it to go on a major sale. STEP UP TO THE PLATE DEVS! Please fix this game.

reviewText:
If your looking for a good police simulator then look no further. This game(as it is still in development) provides almost all the policing experiences a cop could experience in his every day life. However there can definitely be some improvements to the game as far as exanding the map to be more of an open world sandbox and have additional CPU police to patrol around as well and maybe even multiplayer. This game has a huge amount of potential to be the best police simulator out there but it still needs quite a bit of work to get there with minor bugs and a little bit more of a relistic feel. What I mean by realistic feel is when you play the game everyone and everything gameplay mechanics wise seems to be robotic almost, the civilians almost seem like they have no life to them at all, they look like robots walking around and the driving is a little unrealistic in the sense that if a car runs into you, it doesn't harm you but it harms itself by somehow flipping over and going out of control. Like I said though, this game is a great simulator because of the wide variety of missions and calls that a normal cop would answer to in real life. The basic concept of the game is fantastic, its working out great as far as how policing is done so far. If your like early development games and policing then I highly recommend this game, however if you like a full complete game and not something in development then I suggest waiting a little longer before purchasing the game however the price of the game may increase like almost all games that are in development always do.

My suggestions to you devs as far as making the game that much better is
1-Multiplayer. Co-op multiplayer and maybe even VS Drug Lords VS Cops/Swat

2-Implement more AI- patrolling around and busting bad guys and all is really fun but the lack of other police patrolling around and no backup seems a little unrealistic and a little dull, having a team to work with or maybe even command when your a high ranking officer can definitely spice up the gameplay and make it a lot more interesting.

3- Implement S.W.A.T- Everyone loves swat...No question about it. Swat is a huge help during tight situations and if there was even an option to play as swat and just go on raid missions, breaching and clearing, taking out High Value Targets and etc. that would probably spike this games badassery up by a ton. Everyone loves that feeling of being a badass S.W.A.T with a team about to breach and clear or just go into an area to raise absolute hell. Implementing S.W.A.T AI backup in the game and even a S.W.A.T mode would just be awesome

4- Connect the maps together to make one big sandbox- Instead of seperate maps, connect them! I think most people would prefer a sandbox rather than different sections, especially if the different sections of the maps can be really small in comparison to the main city.

5- Implement more traffic violations- I've noticed that every time I pull over a car for blowing a red light or even crashing into another car yields no bad outcome whenever they are pulled over and traffic stopped. I always mistake pulling people over for blowing through red lights and think I'm going to ticket them but the game doesn't pay attention to them blowing red lights, implementing that would be pretty cool too.

For all of those people reading this review all the way through good job! lol and thanks for reading. As for the Devs, nobodys expecting all these suggestions to happen in like one week, we can wait however don't blow the suggestions off otherwise the game will get dull very quickly because there is a lot more that you guys can add to increase the feel of being on the Police Force. Don't quit! This game has potential over all other police simulators to be the best because so far you can do a lot more in this game as far as policing than any other game made so far. You guys are doing a splendid job and I wish you the best of luck developing this game, I can't wait for the final product because if you guys can make it this good this early in development, you guys can definitely make it amazing with time. Don't quit! A lot of people will support this game to the end!

reviewText:
Alright. Never written a review before so. What the hell! Ahem...

I'm going to give this a 3/5 in this case. Mainly because its in its baby stages, and theres more to add in this case.

So far, the gameplay is alright, Simple so far. Start out as a beat cop (Sort of) Walking around, Ticketing vehicles, setting speed traps, pulling over drunk drivers. There is a minor story in both the male and female characters, but that quickly liquidates as..Well. Its a sandbox..Free-roam. So I can't mark down points on that.

The location is....Clunky. In my personal opinion (And others may feel free to disagree) It feels as if you could either move it to a more populated area. (Or create a second map. That would give players a much wider sense of adventure and exploration) Or just expand the area more with more to explore. Eitherway, Once you've seen all the areas, thats it, exploration over.

Combat? Well. Rarely there. Or I havn't really progressed far yet. (First Sergeant so far) Fists are rarely used (You could throw a baton in there for variation.) Firearms are suddenly thrown in. Maybe remove the SMG? I find its rarely used around now. Probably for later ranks. Tazers are not the only non-lethals out there, Pepper spray maybe? Good for short-ranged. Less range than the tazer. More range that your fists (Or baton if its implimented). Two hits and your dead, unstandable. Frustrating when you forget the tazer has only one shot and you have to reload. Maybe throw in body armor later on? Seeing as you will more and likely going up against drug dealers, cartels, gangs. It'd be logical to later on recieve body armor for a small cost. Hey. If it gets worse, throw in S.W.A.T armor/uniform! Baby stages!


Missions. So far. So good! It started slow with simple hunt down drink drivers, or wander drunks, or setting up speed traps. And as I ranked up I started getting more into the dirty side of crime by hunting down the occassional drug dealer. Like I said, in baby stages so far, but more can be added. So looking forward to more here. Some missions I find quite entertaining. 'Go to X and find Z' One I just find inasne......'Illegally parked Vehicles' Okay. So 25 Minutes to find 7 wrongfully parked vehicles. I don't think Mountain Valley has a drug problem, I think it more has a parking problem. And they're so well hidden that I can't find them! I have to traverse map to map sections just to meet my quota! Oh. And some times are too generous. 25 Real time minutes is pretty much 2 shifts. But when your first shift ends, that progress is lost. Be alittle more less lenient on times..... And...Less illegally parked cars...More drugs and gang violance.

Progression. So far, I'm liking the rank tree and the standard 'Gain certain amount of EXP/Score' to rank up. Maybe unlock more uniforms/Vehicles/Housing and such as you level up. Hell. If you get to Sergeant, throw in an NPC Companion maybe! It pays to be ranked! And this job is too dangerous to go alone!

Driving. Okay. So far. This will be the main negative part for this. I took a car out, and I swear I was falling into a 'Back to the Future' Moment. Gently press the accelerate button...And...Atleast a second later. 99MPH..... I had to immediantly slam on the breaks to slow down. Heck. At one point I was going in reverse so fast I had to slam the handbreak on as accelerating did nothing! This requires quite abit of tweaking! And the car repair costs are manic, not just because its expensive, its more that its difficult to NOT hit anything. Cruise helps. But. Eh.

A.I. Uh. Its not great, but its not so bad either. Maybe some more character models for look. They're not so bad walking, they just horrific when driving. Stop one car, the one behind slams into it and slowly (And painfully) Tries to continue moving. Usually people stop as soon as they hit a car, (Or see a policeman giving a ticket to the person in front.) A bit of an intelligence tweak may be required on the drivers.

Customisation? Meh. Five off duty uniforms. Two on duty uniforms. Not great. Maybe add shopping here? Or a new flashy uniform when you rank up? Only one house. Little customisation. An expensive fridge does little to no better than your cheap stock one.

Overall Verdict? So far. So good. Alot of tweaks to be made. It does in its own way feel unique. Realistic. And none of that 'Good cop, Bad Cop' rubbish. (Though kicking in doors is quite a good one without caring for minor loss points.)

Improvements?
- A much stronger progression system. Maybe additional uniforms per promotion. Access to more equipment.
- The cars. The speed is an issue. If I go any faster, I might break the time barrier and see the game in the future.
- A.I. Yeah. Intelligence Tweak when driving.
- Either friendly Police A.I to assist you (Seriously, Can't be the only policeman in this valley right?) Or impliment a co-op feature (Though give that time, Co-Op and multiplayer is when the game is a good few builds away from completion)

Overall. Keep it up. And keep going!

reviewText: After playing for a pretty long time, I have concluded that this game is lacking in all aspects. For example, when I customize my vehicle, it gets completely damaged from the drop animation (at least I think thats what damages it). Another reason is that the game is completely empty, just a bunch of very dumb AI walking around with cars spawning in front of you while you're trying to drive. I see what the devs are trying to achieve, but it looks like they have given up on their game and have moved on. I feel like I have been robbed of $20 because this game is not even worth that much, I would estimate that this game is about $1 at this stage. Another reason I feel robbed is that they actually think that this game is done and have slowed down on making updates which is what makes me furious. This game is not even half done, its 1/10 done. In conclusion, I rate it a 3/10... I will give it a good review when the devs actually start giving a damn about this game.

reviewText:
Pros;
- Graphics are not bad
- Large map
- Seems like a lot of hours playing time is envolved
- Interesting customization options for cars and homes
- Massive potential to become a great game if develops spend time on updating it

Cons;
- Driving feels stiff and can be very tough especially at high speed
- Missions feel repetive and sometimes can be a nusance
- Lack of a sturdy story line
- Sometimes feel's as if there is no point or goal except from the level system
- Days go by very quickly and the character gets tired fast
- Struggle to keep my stress levels correct

At the current stage i would give this a 6/10 becasue it is an interesting concept. However i feel like there is alot of improvement that can be added to this game,. Here are my ideas;

- Story Line and Missions to complete as well as everyday cruising etc...
- Better turning because at slow speeds turning is smooth however it is a struggle to stay on the road at high speeds and i tend to crash... alot!
- Time needs to go slower and you need to be able to have like days off and things to do during your days off. I know there is Visiting people but this is just a waste of time.

Thanks for Reading!

reviewText:
The good: The concept of the game is great. Being a police officer and being able to do whatever a police officer does on a daily basics makes the game great. Not to mention the ranking system which gives the game a more MMO feel, where you need to get enough points to rank up to the next level.

The bad: Sadly, there is more bad then good. Pretty much the only major bugs/glitches that the game has is with vehicles. Just driving a car feels really bad, in the sense that simply moving forward and turning left for just a second makes the car almost instantly turn 90 degrees. Also sometimes when driving fast and colliding with sidewalks or passing intersections makes the car fly into the air, and do a couple of flips.

Another glitch is tha sometimes when firing at an armed criminal, your bullets dont shoot correctly. And by that I mean dont shoot at all, leaving you free to get shot by the armed criminal.

I am still recommending this game because as a police fan, this is perfect for me. Adding on that there is no other stable game that accomplishes this.
voteText: 10 of 19 people (53%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Enforcer: Police Crime Action,

Is one of those games that don't look like much when you watch the screenshots, but after playing for just a couple of minutes I'm alreay caught in the game.
It's fun, cool and somehow gets the job done.
This game is not about shooting and gunning down some unknown people. this game wants you to uphold the law by sticking to the law.
A very fresh take and it's a lot of fun.

Isn't their anything negative?
Uhm, yes, as a matter of fact there's.
For instance:
- The ingame map is not always that clear for some reason (Could do with some better artwork, or at least a zoom level)
- Textures are adequate, but sub par for modern games. Although it doesn't hinder the gameplay and fun factor.
- Controls are not always clear. There're many different options and as such you're not always sure how things work. A quick peek manual would be nice.
-Ingame time. A full days lasts 24 minutes. In my opinion that's way to fast. I like my days a bit more longer lasting. Let's say 60 minutes or so.



So far, this is a nice game already and I'll see myself having lots of fun with it in the future. Especially if they're able to fix some of the things mentioned above.

reviewText:
This game has a LOT of potential. So far, in its early stages, it's proven to be a very fun game. I played it for about 2 hours and got to level 4. I was a little disappointed that I couldn't figure out how exactly I can get my new car.

Now, in the start, you have to spend the first 5 minutes just reading through a very long text that explains how everything works. Instead, I'd suggest a categorized way of looking through things. That way it's better to look over things later on as well.

The game mechanics are.. they're not the best. It's sluggish, the car handling is pretty crap and civilians driving trucks often cause traffic jams because they can't turn a tight corner. As far as civilian interaction goes and completing missions that involve finding suspects, it's pretty much impossible. I mean my first callout was a vandalism case. I asked the guy who called what the vandals look like and he gave me the descriptions of them. Problem was, the descriptions matched like 3 nearby NPCs. I'd have no way of knowing which one of them is the real criminal. Some diversity in appearances would be nice. Just retexture the clothes, if you must.

DUIs are a little confusing. So I check someones breath and they're under the influence. I get them out, place them under arrest and it gets ticked under Innocent Civilians Arrested"? DUI is an arrestable crime in pretty much every state in America. Wut.

As far as on-duty off-duty time goes
date: I think there's way too much effort put into the off-duty aspect. The stress level is.. meh. Hanging out with your mother/sister/grandparents/friends doesn't even give you any stress points
recommended: which is weird. And what's with the applause as if I've just won an Oscar after hanging out with people?\n\nThe police vehicle itself is well done
hoursPlayed: as well as the interactables. Indicators
voteText: siren and the strobes themselves. However
helpfulPercent: it being just red is kind of bland. Red and blue in the future pls. Oh and while I think to mention it
votesHelpful: please add a tutorial on how to get a new police vehicle
votesTotal:
because I have not got a clue on how to get my new ones.

The game is built on a strange engine as well. I mean the graphics aren't really top of the line and I'm lagging horribly unless I run it under low graphics. It doesn't make much sense that I can run Payday 2 better than I can run this.

There should also be a little bit of further research be done on the ranks. I mean you don't have Police Officer and then Senior Deputy. Deputy = Sheriff's Office/Department (county). Police Officer = Police Department (city).

All in all
votesFunny: like I said
commentsCount: it's a pretty good game with a lot of potential. Needs a lot of polishing. I mean the English itself in the game is sometimes bizarre."

reviewText:
(Important note for Fsecure users: Disable deepguard while you play this game)
For anyone with an interest in police work, this is a fairly good game. The calls are varied and the situations feel organic with the suspects reacting in a believable manner. For example, drunks and thieves are unlikely to pull a gun on you (but much more likely to flee) while hardcore criminals with drug raps and worse tend to violently object to your stopping their crime sprees. Also, the locations of the criminals are not automatic and sometimes you just have to go around looking for them either from witness descriptions or behaviour described in the initial call (example: rowdy drunk). The game does give you hints after a time in the form of radio updates about the rough location of the suspect(s), if you are worried about never finding the perps.
The police procedures are sometimes a bit off (you generally want to cuff the perps before searching them, devs...) but overall the basics are there. Note that this game is meant for people who WANT to follow police procedure. If you want to mess around, the game basically ignores it and it will feel weird. But then again, if you just want to mess around in an open world, why are you here? GTA series are that way --->
The game has problems too. The driving model is wonky and there are some glitches and bugs around, some amusing (like trucks launching in to orbit) and some not (a car parked 10m in the air....).Its not the prettiest game in any way, shape or form either.

In the end of the day, this is a game for cop fans and no-one else. Being one, i recommend it. If you have no interest in patrol police work then this game is really not for you.

reviewText:
Enforcer Police Crime Action game is one of a kind game and also exactly what i was looking for. The developers have allot of work to do with this game as it is unfinished. The game is easy and hard at the same time. I got up to 2000 career score than in one mission dropped to -200 and had died. The reason i was chasing a burglar suspect who was running had my taser out trying to stop him and npcs started running scared i assume. The suspect turned on me with a gun since you can't key bind i brought up my radio instead of my gun had to cancel that screen got my gun out than had to aim. Once aimed i tried shooting but a npc run in front of the suspect and i killed the Innocent person who in real life wouldn't running towards someone with a guy aimed at a cop. Than i tried shooting the suspect but it was too late he killed me. And since there is no save function i lose all my current score and went into the minus.

But i like the idea of the game it offers a good experience as what it would be like to be a police officer. Its well done for what there is and i know they are still working on it since its a early release game. The price is right and i happy with what i got for what i paid for. If this game was made by someone like bio-ware they would have had the money to develop it but then the game would be 50 bucks.

The developers are doing a great job on this game and i hope they listen to the player base feedback.

reviewText:
This game has a very solid base, but obviously is the first of it's kind so yes, it is extremely rough around the edges. Those not recommending the game in their reviews clearly aren't looking at the big picture, and don't understand how gaming (or Economics for that matter) works.

First off, I'd like to remind everyone that the original GTA is a piece of ♥♥♥♥. The original 3D sandbox GTA, GTA III is a piece of ♥♥♥♥. But we would have never gotten to the glory that is Grand Theft Auto 5 if people just simply looked at the graphics and didn't support it. This game has alot of promise, and I'm willing to bet tha with the right ammount of support, the developers can turn this into a franchise game easily as it's not your run of the mill shooter. It's a mix of Shooter, Simulation, Roleplay, and Strategy. And you have to balance all three to be successful, thats what makes a good game, variety and uniqueness, not graphics. If you think otherwise, then you're not a real gamer.

I'd recommend you just get it now if you're on the fence, 14.99 is alot better to spend than 19.99, and the price on the Excaliber site is nearly $25, so you're gonna have to make a choice. And if you'd prefer to just hear me say it and watch what the games about than read check it out: http://youtu.be/kNCU_RlzBKU

reviewText:
This game has a LOT of potential. So far, in its early stages, it's proven to be a very fun game. I played it for about 2 hours and got to level 4. I was a little disappointed that I couldn't figure out how exactly I can get my new car.

Now, in the start, you have to spend the first 5 minutes just reading through a very long text that explains how everything works. Instead, I'd suggest a categorized way of looking through things. That way it's better to look over things later on as well.

The game mechanics are.. they're not the best. It's sluggish, the car handling is pretty crap and civilians driving trucks often cause traffic jams because they can't turn a tight corner. As far as civilian interaction goes and completing missions that involve finding suspects, it's pretty much impossible. I mean my first callout was a vandalism case. I asked the guy who called what the vandals look like and he gave me the descriptions of them. Problem was, the descriptions matched like 3 nearby NPCs. I'd have no way of knowing which one of them is the real criminal. Some diversity in appearances would be nice. Just retexture the clothes, if you must.

DUIs are a little confusing. So I check someones breath and they're under the influence. I get them out, place them under arrest and it gets ticked under Innocent Civilians Arrested"? DUI is an arrestable crime in pretty much every state in America. Wut.

As far as on-duty off-duty time goes
date: I think there's way too much effort put into the off-duty aspect. The stress level is.. meh. Hanging out with your mother/sister/grandparents/friends doesn't even give you any stress points
recommended: which is weird. And what's with the applause as if I've just won an Oscar after hanging out with people?\n\nThe police vehicle itself is well done
hoursPlayed: as well as the interactables. Indicators
voteText: siren and the strobes themselves. However
helpfulPercent: it being just red is kind of bland. Red and blue in the future pls. Oh and while I think to mention it
votesHelpful: please add a tutorial on how to get a new police vehicle
votesTotal:
because I have not got a clue on how to get my new ones.

The game is built on a strange engine as well. I mean the graphics aren't really top of the line and I'm lagging horribly unless I run it under low graphics. It doesn't make much sense that I can run Payday 2 better than I can run this.

There should also be a little bit of further research be done on the ranks. I mean you don't have Police Officer and then Senior Deputy. Deputy = Sheriff's Office/Department (county). Police Officer = Police Department (city).

All in all
votesFunny: like I said
commentsCount: it's a pretty good game with a lot of potential. Needs a lot of polishing. I mean the English itself in the game is sometimes bizarre."

reviewText: I really want to like this game. I mean really. I've been griping for years that after so many incarnations of GTA, we could at least have one open world cop game. (True Crime doesnt count there's too much of a fantasy element there) But in it's current state, this game is only kind of OK. But at the current price, it's just not worth picking up until some things get ironed out. Such as the driving; it's the worst driving with a mouse and keyboard I've ever experienced. I feel like this could be remedied by figureing out a way to have controller support. While it wouldn't really fix the problem, it could make the problem a lot less evident. Character movement is akward, though not as bad as the driving. I would go out on a limb to say that it's passable, but it still needs work as well. I also feel like the devs are working on trying to work on making the game bigger and more complex before addressing these fundemental issues. Overall I cannot recommend this game for it's current state and price. There is loads of potential here though. So hopefully one day that price will reflect what could be a very cool, unique game.

reviewText:
-So my first day on the force as Officer: Officer Hyena
-I am tasked with finding cars parked in the wrong spot. I leave me car halfway on a sidewalk to investigate in a town consisting of about 3 blocks of houses
-I find around 6 cars, give them tickets, give one correctly parked car a ticket because it was an ugly shade of yellow. I can no longer find my car.
-Hear a report of a woman buying drugs. I go toward the general area of the crime on foot
-It is at the other end of the town
-It leads me down an alleyway. I round the corner and she shoots me in the face with a military grade assault rifle
-But she is white so I taze and handcuff her
-I don't have a car to transport her
-Her punishment is to WALK the entire distance of the town handcuffed behind me.
-I then get a report of a kidnapped child
-My shift already ended. I get a taxi home and sleep. After all: 'The first 24 hours are the least important time to find someone who is kidnapped.'
-Best 30 minutes of gameplay ever

reviewText: The reason I'm saying no because as of my review date (10-25-14) the game still has many bugs. The drving mechanics are very wonky. The game mechanics just are kind of angering, the sleep, stress, hunger, gas, and car health meters go down way too fast. And because the most per shift I've even gotten so far is $300 and taking into consideration $50 for gas and $300 for repairs, you begin to lose money or make very little profit. And the game in general lags horribley.\nOn the positive side, I do see a chance for this game if they work the driving mechanics out and I'll look into about changing the depletion speeds. Also I would like to see a longer allowed time to be off duty, and if your cop car either had to stay at your house when not being used or at the police station when not being used. Instead of this thing where you park at the police station, go off duty, take a cab home, go to bed, wake up, go on duty, and boom your car is magically in your driveway. Just make it go one way or the other.\nAnyways I'm sure I'm missing out more major bugs, but anywyas I would not recommend buying this game until they fix quite a few things. And like I said, it has a chance, hopefully.

reviewText:
As much as I watched this game receive a lot of negative publicity when it first launched, all the glitches, the game breaking glitches, and so on. Just about yesterday did I really give this title a chance. Now I am addicted to it. For some odd reason. Allow me to give some Positives and Negatives on the game. So you can decide to make your purchase.

Positives: -Plenty of Dispatch Missions to take advantage of, which are Challengings and Fun.
-Your Police Vehicle has many customization options.
-Wide vast area with much to explore.
-Plenty of criminals to arrest.
-Responsive Controls.
-Driving feels very fluent, but takes time to get used to.
-Music is actually very good.
-Voice acting is on point.
-There is always something to do, even when there are no missions available.
-Ranking up feels rewarding as you get an increase in pay.
-Weather & Night to Day transitions are wonderfully done.
-You are able to decorate and buy new things for your home.

Negatives: -Aiming can be a chore to pull off, when you are about to get shot.
-Sometimes when doing routine checks on cars, the person driving the car will run sometimes, also very far.
-When you arrest someone, you are forced to walk. When you want to put them in your car, especially if they run a far distance, walking takes forever to get back to your car which will inspire you to call police dispatch to lighten the burden.
-When finished with routine missions, entering the police station for a warrant based on a mission is a problem. When you step back outside the station, the game forces another routine mission on you, removing the perp from the map. Making it difficult to find where they are again. Unless Dispatch decides to update you on their location, which can take a terribly long time.
-illegally parked cars don't spawn often, unless you quit, and restart the game. So when asked to ticket illegally parked cars, there are usually none in the street. There is a way around this by ticketing cars on the street by checking their license plates, and ticketing them that way. Its the only way around it.
-You take no damage by getting hit by cars. They usually flip over you. Also you cannot kill a pedestrian by hitting them.
-You can only arrest one person at a time. When you're after two perps, you have to dispatch the one first, while the other has the chance to escape as you cannot go after them when you have someone handcuffed.
-Sometimes Dispatch missions never show up. Because of a game glitch. You have to sleep 8 hours & restart the game. The glitch is caused by the Stress meter being too low. The game gets confused and doesn't turn back Dispatch calls on.
-AI pedestrians have a habit of endlessly walking into vehicles, perps in houses run endlessly into the wall, or the door with their body peeking out of the door when you try to arrest them.
-The game has a bad habit of throwing you missions even after your shift is over. They should stop. Because when you end your shift with a mission active, even if its routine, you are penalized points. Which you need to rank up.

Even with the negatives I think the game is still very enjoyable. Regardless, its up to the buyer. Happy New Year everyone.

reviewText:
Final Update:26 March 2016 - Deleting off my HDD, devs don't give a damn about fixing this mess, but keep coming up with new exotic excuses as to why. This game will never be fixed, as they are playing everyone daft enough to buy it as mugs.

12 Febuary, update a disaster, so bad, they rolled back to previous build. Do they understand the concept of Quality Assurance?
5 Febuary. Latest update FINALLY released. WTF, more bugs than ever, more unplayable. What the hell are the devs doing?
27 January. Latest excuse is that players want free update?? Since when has it been normal to charge for bug fixes?
10 January 2016, still no update or comms from the dev. Only sign that there not dead is the censorship in the forums they are carrying out..
19 December, no update, and devs actively censoring the forums to remove any 'negative' threads and comments, while not actually giving any response.

Unfinished and full of bugs. Devs talk a lot about the 'update coming', but was due June 15, still no show near end of October 15. Many threads locked down and being directed to their list of excuses as to why they can't finish/ can only have 1 person part time working on it (Looks like they believe their next game is more important than actually finishing this one). And finally, if you want to try and see any progress they claim, you have to have a Facebook account (for a game thats sold on STEAM)?

Below a small list of some of the bugs/poor gameplay i have experianced:
i. Unable to execute handbrake turn(car slides sideways and backwards at about 40 degrees).
ii. 70 mph max on road and offroad, road and terrian has no effect.
iii. Suspects running up a cliffside half inside the sheer face.
iv. Any vehicle impact(such as stopping drunk driver), by rear ramming, results in your car being bounced high onto the air, as the car stops dead on the road(the physics suck).
v. Chasing a vehicle off map ,new map has car sitting on side of road, engine off and suspect vehicle disappered.
vi. A suspect pulls a gun on you, but if you shoot them before they open fire, you get a hefty penalty, for opening fire on an innocent. Then when you call for the medical services, you get a bonous for completing the mission and removing another criminal from the streets.

reviewText:
If you don't wanna read the entire thing, skip to the bottom for a tl;dr version.

It seems the developers removed my review.  Go figured they wanted to hide the negative review.  I was one of the first people to play this game, and I spent several months not only playing it, but being the sole community moderator.  Enforcer is an arcade-style game.  I honestly wouldn't even call it a simulator.  Yes, you play as a cop, you can pull people over, respond to calls, etc but the game is just terrible.  The graphics are bad, movement is bad, driving is bad, general physics is bad.  Essentially, EVERYTHING about this game is bad.

For the first few hours you can enjoy it, but after that you realize how annoying the game actually is.  The AI is a joke!  The AI drivers are terrible, which reflects back on the developer for not making a decent AI.  Here's one example:  I pull over someone for running a red light and give them a ticket.  As soon as they leave the traffic stop, they do it again!  There was even one intersection where cars would always despawn coming from a certain direction.

The worst part about this game is the developer and thee publisher.  Kaligus and Chris.  They try so hard to justify their inability to properly fix this game and make it worth $20.  Excuse after excuse.  Updates are coming." Yet
recommended: one year later and only 3-4 updates have even been released.  Both of these people are purely incompetent.  When I was a moderator
hoursPlayed: I was the sole community-to staff interaction.  They essentially made me the public relations guy because they are TERRIBLE at talking to their community.  Since I stepped down
voteText: their communications with the communtiy has decreased to almost none!  When Chris does post
helpfulPercent: all he does is post linking to a topic that talks about an update.  Nothing else.\n\nCustomization wise

votesTotal: but one of the lightbars has been broken since day one.\n\nYou can choose from various different cars; from a Crown Vic to a Charger
votesFunny: to a Tahoe to an F150 to even a bike
commentsCount:
You can use custom textures on vehicles that were created by the community.

Finally

reviewText:
As much as I watched this game receive a lot of negative publicity when it first launched, all the glitches, the game breaking glitches, and so on. Just about yesterday did I really give this title a chance. Now I am addicted to it. For some odd reason. Allow me to give some Positives and Negatives on the game. So you can decide to make your purchase.

Positives: -Plenty of Dispatch Missions to take advantage of, which are Challengings and Fun.
-Your Police Vehicle has many customization options.
-Wide vast area with much to explore.
-Plenty of criminals to arrest.
-Responsive Controls.
-Driving feels very fluent, but takes time to get used to.
-Music is actually very good.
-Voice acting is on point.
-There is always something to do, even when there are no missions available.
-Ranking up feels rewarding as you get an increase in pay.
-Weather & Night to Day transitions are wonderfully done.
-You are able to decorate and buy new things for your home.

Negatives: -Aiming can be a chore to pull off, when you are about to get shot.
-Sometimes when doing routine checks on cars, the person driving the car will run sometimes, also very far.
-When you arrest someone, you are forced to walk. When you want to put them in your car, especially if they run a far distance, walking takes forever to get back to your car which will inspire you to call police dispatch to lighten the burden.
-When finished with routine missions, entering the police station for a warrant based on a mission is a problem. When you step back outside the station, the game forces another routine mission on you, removing the perp from the map. Making it difficult to find where they are again. Unless Dispatch decides to update you on their location, which can take a terribly long time.
-illegally parked cars don't spawn often, unless you quit, and restart the game. So when asked to ticket illegally parked cars, there are usually none in the street. There is a way around this by ticketing cars on the street by checking their license plates, and ticketing them that way. Its the only way around it.
-You take no damage by getting hit by cars. They usually flip over you. Also you cannot kill a pedestrian by hitting them.
-You can only arrest one person at a time. When you're after two perps, you have to dispatch the one first, while the other has the chance to escape as you cannot go after them when you have someone handcuffed.
-Sometimes Dispatch missions never show up. Because of a game glitch. You have to sleep 8 hours & restart the game. The glitch is caused by the Stress meter being too low. The game gets confused and doesn't turn back Dispatch calls on.
-AI pedestrians have a habit of endlessly walking into vehicles, perps in houses run endlessly into the wall, or the door with their body peeking out of the door when you try to arrest them.
-The game has a bad habit of throwing you missions even after your shift is over. They should stop. Because when you end your shift with a mission active, even if its routine, you are penalized points. Which you need to rank up.

Even with the negatives I think the game is still very enjoyable. Regardless, its up to the buyer. Happy New Year everyone.

reviewText:
Final Update:26 March 2016 - Deleting off my HDD, devs don't give a damn about fixing this mess, but keep coming up with new exotic excuses as to why. This game will never be fixed, as they are playing everyone daft enough to buy it as mugs.

12 Febuary, update a disaster, so bad, they rolled back to previous build. Do they understand the concept of Quality Assurance?
5 Febuary. Latest update FINALLY released. WTF, more bugs than ever, more unplayable. What the hell are the devs doing?
27 January. Latest excuse is that players want free update?? Since when has it been normal to charge for bug fixes?
10 January 2016, still no update or comms from the dev. Only sign that there not dead is the censorship in the forums they are carrying out..
19 December, no update, and devs actively censoring the forums to remove any 'negative' threads and comments, while not actually giving any response.

Unfinished and full of bugs. Devs talk a lot about the 'update coming', but was due June 15, still no show near end of October 15. Many threads locked down and being directed to their list of excuses as to why they can't finish/ can only have 1 person part time working on it (Looks like they believe their next game is more important than actually finishing this one). And finally, if you want to try and see any progress they claim, you have to have a Facebook account (for a game thats sold on STEAM)?

Below a small list of some of the bugs/poor gameplay i have experianced:
i. Unable to execute handbrake turn(car slides sideways and backwards at about 40 degrees).
ii. 70 mph max on road and offroad, road and terrian has no effect.
iii. Suspects running up a cliffside half inside the sheer face.
iv. Any vehicle impact(such as stopping drunk driver), by rear ramming, results in your car being bounced high onto the air, as the car stops dead on the road(the physics suck).
v. Chasing a vehicle off map ,new map has car sitting on side of road, engine off and suspect vehicle disappered.
vi. A suspect pulls a gun on you, but if you shoot them before they open fire, you get a hefty penalty, for opening fire on an innocent. Then when you call for the medical services, you get a bonous for completing the mission and removing another criminal from the streets.

reviewText:
Enforcer: Police Crime Action Small Review	Written by: CheezyTheNerd

In this short review I will be going over a few this about this game, an In the future will write a review a full longer review for this game. Keep In-mind this review has been written on my beliefs In which I have seen an experienced, we all experience things In different ways. I am writting this review to show people my experience on this game.


Review                        Gameplay        The overall gameplay for Enforcer: Police Crime Action, Is basically grand theft auto with less features In a nut shell . The gameplay Is kinda hard to play, with It's slow moving ability an the slight less appealable grahpics. (Which I will speak about In the graphics section). This game has a lot of policing features more then most Police Role-play games , but overall some of the features are quite buggy an not to real-life standards. This game had so much potentianl In certain areas but now just lacks the motivation of the development team to place the certain items In to that game. I rate the gameplay for Enforcer: Police Crime Action a 3/10.                 Graphics        Enforcer: Police Crime Actions graphic portion of the game lacks In some what of a way. It feels like the game was just based of a pre-made system such as unity. In most games being released there Is a Increased In graphical enchancement. I was terribly upset with the graphic portion of this game, In lacked certain graphics but I can't expect much In a game that wasn't properly prepared. I would rate the graphics for Enforcer: Police Crime Action 2/10.                 Developers        I haven't spent to much time In looking Into the development team, but I can say this the team Is small and not that much time seems to be put Into this project. I state this because most games they have the deverlopers always reaching out the public of gamers looking to hear what they want In a game. I have followed the forums for a bit to see if any of that Is happening an I haven't seen much of It. I feel that If that this team was larger and had more love an motivation towards this game an It's future I could see a better future for this game an it's community. I would rate the Developers portion 5/10
I believe this game should have went In alpha before becoming a full released game, It was all rushed an didn't recieve the proper attention It needed from the developers of the game.

Enforcer: Police Crime Action Rating - 4.5/10	I did enjoy playing this game an have made several videos of It, In which I will have attached below.

(several videos I have made)

reviewText:
YES! YES! YES!

This game is great and if you ask me, underrated. So far, there's enough to do in a day to keep you mostly satisfied. I would like to see more in future updates. I will leave a list of my own suggestions towards the end of my little review here. The graphics aren't impressive, but they're at least tolerable. The vehicle handling has something left to be desired, mostly the handling. Cars pick up speed well enough but turning without hitting anything is tough lol at least for me it was. If you crash into a pole it will knock over, that's a plus. I really dislike a stiff enviroment that doesn't react somewhat realistically to that kind of damage. Car models are decent and acceptable. Customizing your apartment is a nice perk, although somewhat limited. REALLY enjoy the traffic cameras. Theyre fun to play with when you just want to sit and watch the pedestrians try and get one over ya behind the wheel >:D

Would like to see in future updates:

Longer shifts (I am aware that players can edit files to lengthen day and night times, since I and others are not this comp savvy...I would like the devs to give players an option to set their shift lengths in game.)

More cars! :D Cant go wrong with that can you?

SWAT teams after certain ranks, which can also brings me to this : add more NPCs that rob banks and shops.

Multiplayer modes like Cops VS Robbers, Co-op shifts, and just open servers for random lawlessness.

MORE CUSTOMIZATION FOR YOUR CHARACTER AND THEIR HOME! :D

Armor upgrades

Vehicle customization on a deeper level (speed, acceleration, breaking, armor rating, ect)

Weapon customization (purchasable unlocks, attatchments, police equipment, ect)

When you reach police cheif, there should be an option to run the city" where you are able to command other officers and oversee them. Perhaps some officers are corrupt and you need to do some surveillance? Or you need to manage a dispute between to officers who are partners? or you need to hire or fire more officers? upkeep on funding for vehicle management and police needs (equipment
recommended:
ect)

A ranking system that goes a tad bit beyond medals you only see dangling after a days work. Perhaps some wearable rank insignia? Or more priviledges/jobs to do that officers of that rank do irl? profile badges that signify rank?

A "superior NPC" who monitors your performance
hoursPlayed: chimes in with advice via the radio or in person after a days work
voteText:
pushes you to do better or to do certain things to make quota.

Just my own input.

Two thumbs up so far

votesHelpful: here it is :D"

reviewText: I gotta admit, this game has it's pro's. I like a bit of realism, and being able to pull over, check, breathalyze, arrest and transport is lot's of fun. The constantly running perps who take you miles from your vehicle, the tedium of keeping your stress level down, and the annoyance of having to play hours before you can drive around off duty are pretty big detractors. Having said that it appears the developers are working very hard to get this right (eventually) and that speaks volumes for the games appeal. Is it LCPD:FR? Nope, but it is trying, and with the addition of backup units, even a cutscene style state police call where they come and help" by arresting the fleeing vehicle
date: (I'm tired of spending tons of money fixing a cop car that has to be used as a battering ram every time I get in a chase) would make this game absolutley worth it. For now 6/10 with the potential for 9/10. Go ahead and buy it
recommended: play it a little and wait for those awesome updates I'm expecting soon."

reviewText: While not perfect this game is fantastic. I say this because rarely does a game make me lose all track of time. I grew up with the Police Quest series and until recently, I've played the Police Force series from Excalibur Publishing  (makers of Simulator games). About a year ago, the maker of Police Quest, Jim Walls, was trying to revive the Police Quest series and bring it into the 21st Century but sadly it left Kickstarter and ceased.\n\nIf you've played Police Force, there are some things alike. You can walk around, accept emergencies, and use the number keys for actions
date:
Enforcer definately uses Police Force as a foundation but expands on it greatly and whoever put it all together definately should get a raise!

I have to say that the devloper and his team really did a great job. You are able to have a home and when your shift is over, you can spend time there eating, watching TV, showering, sleeping, and/or taking a nap. Any of these things can help your stress, hunger, and alertness. All of these can have an affect on your aiming in sticky situations as well as your life ( you can die if you don't eat). You can explore any of the 7 regions but your patrol area is within Mountain View. You can buy furnishings for your home and at a higher rank, you can upgrade your patrol car as well as buy a car while off duty. Your home is kind of bland. I wish that my house looked a little nicer than the shack it resembles. I do find it odd that when I'm off duty, my patrol car seems to be parked at my house. I though I would have to drive (walk, or take a cab) to the Police Station, and get to my patrol car. When I go to the Police Station it's void of any NPCs. Your main reason inside the Police Station is too check email, ask for a warrant, or go off duty. When you have suspects in custody, all you do is click the police station door (without going in) and a window pops up asking if you want to put the suspects in jail. Clicking the window, tells you how you did (giving expierence). You also get expierence putting tickets on illegally parked cars and towing them away when a driver fails a breathalyzer test.

While on duty, dispatch will squawk emergencies and you have the option of excepting. If you do, dispatch alerts other officers that 26" (your call) is in route. It would of been nice like in Police Quest

reviewText:
First off, I love this game. However, it does have flaws that need to be adressed.
1: Vehicle handling is awful. Doesn't even make sense at times.
2: Running criminals will stop and walk normally like nothing ever happened after 30 yards, instead of continuing to run or trying to hide.
3: Criminals with guns with will sometimes wait up to 8 seconds to start shooting you.
4: There are not enough things to spend your money on. You only get to buy 3 cars, and buying furniture for your house is nice, but not enough. It would be nice to be able to buy a new house, and place it wherever we want.
5: You can not recruit a partner, which is very unrealistic.
6: Gun play is not very good, considering there is no recoil at all. It would be nice if there was, and as we gain stress levels, the recoil becomes greater.
7: Criminal AI is awful, they stand in one spot when trying to shoot you, instead of trying to get behind cover.
8: We need more content, after you play the game for about 3 days, you have pretty much seen everything there is to the game. Give us more missions, more cars, more houses, more gun options, gun customization, a recoil system, partners, trucks, ect.
9: It would be nice to have an actual Story Mode. This would entice us to keep playing and staying interested in the game. It mentions that your grandparents dont have much time to live, maybe you could play on that a little bit?
10: MULTIPLAYER! The fun of this game would increse tenfold if we could play with a friend.

I'll say this again, I love this game and want to see it grow. However it is very unpolished and until the problems listed above are adressed, I couldn't reccomend this game to just anyone. But if you could look past the problems, you just may find your new favorite game.
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

Pros

4. Still fun to play a bit I hope they keep updating and improving the game though. +1

reviewText:
The game can be fun and has a lot of potential, but it is ridiculously repetitive. I am currently playing on Normal difficulty so that there is no permadeath and all you ever do is find cars that are parked illegally or check for drunk drivers. I don't want to do any of that stuff for an extended period of time. I want actual calls to respond to. It's not fun doing the same crap every single shift. If you're *lucky*, you may get one call per shift (like every 20 minutes).

I absolutely love police and firefighting games, but I cannot recommend this game in its current state. In order for me to recommend this game, the following needs to be done:

1. Better AI: criminals tend to give up immediately upon pressing C".

2. Smoother transitions with weapons and aiming: I've died multiple times because the aim system is very odd. Also
date: you should be able to pull the trigger whether you're aiming or not. In real life situations
recommended:
you aren't always going to be able to aim at your target if he/she is at point-blank range.

3. More frequent missions: I really can't express this enough. I don't want to spend my entire shift switching from giving parking tickets to taking people to jail for a DUI. That's not fun. I want to finish up with one call and immediately have to go to another call to take care of them.

4. Limiting players to one call on Normal mode is bad: The fact that I don't want to die permanently has no bearing on my ability to multi-task. I really don't know why they thought it was a good idea to only allow you one mission at a time in Normal mode. In an Easy mode
hoursPlayed: perhaps."

reviewText: If you have ever played GTA IV LCPDFR then you know the love of serious, realistic, police simulation games. In addition if you have played LCPDFR you know the struggle to get the mods you want to work, hell you had problems getting GTA IV to start, but you did what you had to, stayed up through the night to get everything working because you know how fun it is, and now you are looking at this game because its like LCPDFR except you don't have to worry about bugs, crashes, bad mods, no. Finally a game based around the idea of police simulation. Now the question is, is this game good? Is it what we all wanted? The answer, is yes. Amazingly this seems to be the first success of its kind and on my very first day of playing it I already had 5 hours, keep in mind this was not made by Rockstar, this was made by an indie developer so this is not GTA 6 Police, not even close. This game still has minor bugs, it still needs polishing, it is not finished. Currently the game is very enjoyable and playable, none of the minor drawbacks that I just mentioned damper the games fun factor" at all. All I meant by saying that is do not expect GTA 6 Police

reviewText:
I think this game gets unjust reviews. Sure, its graphics can be considered lacking, maybe around a more ps2 style, but that just means older pcs are welcome to join in on the fun. Driving is touchy, especially in the different models, but there are more than enough good moments in this game to keep a player coming back. The pedestrians are quirky, so it may seem lame to some, but I think it breaks up the repetitiveness of the game. Different things to do, such as setting up road blocks or speed radars, busting drug dealers who seem to always have a gun, serving warrants and more. This game isnt difficult to learn, and is a great time killer. I got on Steam sale for 9.99, and I would say that is the price YOU should shoot for.
Pros
-Variety of missions leading to different styles of gameplay.  (Laid back pulling speeders over, or gun ho, busting dealers)
-Customizable clothes, cars, and house.  (Not a huge variety, but enough to set you a part)
-Easy to learn
-Tons of potential
-Taser the ♥♥♥♥ out of someone.

Cons
-Outdated Graphics (Older systems welcome)
-Touchy driving system
-Lack of interaction with HQ, other officers, and other agencies.
-Turning on/off car over and over
-Turning on/off all your lights and your siren.
-Gas and damage system are “iffy”

7/10
Would smoke a bowl waiting for speeders just to have the perp run on me so I can shoot them in the back with 10,000 volts.

reviewText:
I bought this game because it look like a pretty good game so far i have ranked up.

Buggy: yes the game is a bit buggy but what do you expect out of a game when it newly fresh also the streets do need to be redone some arears the road sticks up.

Sound: is pretty good but also a little buggy sometimes.

Mission: you won't get board of the mission but the only thing is the timer in which you have to complete them.

Weapons: you get the standard weapons  Gun, taser , and machine gun.

Stress Relief System ;  It's okay but you either have to visit friends or family or watch TV to be calm.

Eating and Sleeping:  Just make sure you watch your meter before it drains.

Fuel consumpton and Damage :  To me i think it too much but hey can't live in god mode all the time  just make sure you fill up.

Money; It takes alot of money to do things but really why the high prices.

Vehicles:  Crown victoria, Dodge Charger, SUV and a undercover Crown Victoria  Depending on your Ranking.

Vehicle Etc.  You can change the lightbar the light bar color wheels and paint.

Character:  You can pick between a Male or Female it lacks customization.

Movement:  Needs Improvement

Shooting:  Needs Improvement

Graphics:  Needs Improvement.

Forget it the games needs a ton of improvements.

But i could go on but i don't want to board anybody. Might edit this after work.

Overall Truth:

Do not waste your money on this. I only do this to  help other people out.  The Developers have enough experience to really do a good game but choose not too,  The only really thing I do not like about this game is that you are the only cop in town there no backup no nothing noone to help you when you need it.

I know its a small town but my goodness why put alot mor pressure on the player.

Game Rateing is a 3 out of 10.

reviewText: There are a few glitches but overall the game is very good and far less problems than with most major releases. The mixture of on and off duty gives an immersive feel and the map size, even with only one zone unlocked, gives a substantial area to patrol and be responsible for while on duty. The inclusion of family life as part of off duty activity and purchasing personal items adds in depth feel. overall graphics are quite good and more than adequate. Undoubtedly there will be a patch released in short order, which is rather common these days to address the glitches present.

reviewText:
I don't recommend this game because it crashes often... The concept is solid, but the programmers really needed to test it on more systems.

4 gb of ram for this game is a steep requirement?! I can run the Sims 3 with most of the addon content all day long without crashes!

I meet all the requirements yet when i try to leave my house dressed as a cop the game crashes every time. I can seem to leave the house as the off duty version of my protagonist, but as the cop it's a no go. I have a suspicion that the way the programmers have the game handling the memory allocation has something to do with this issue. I think the game is trying to load everything in one big data dump on the computer eating all the memory all at once.

I also found that it crashed out upon trying to re-enter my house as the off duty version of my character, again sounds like poor memory handling coding.

Interestingly enough i tried running the game in 256 color mode and it runs, except the game is unplayable because it looks like you have the predator's eyes...

At least it wasn't very expensive, but i really wish the developers would have told everyone that they needed 8 gb of ram instead of 4 to run a flash game...

reviewText:
I really enjoy playing this game and I’m glad I bought it.

I like that I can decide whether to take a mission or just do what I like; I can go and arrest some crazed murderer on the other side of town, or I can go on a power trip and randomly pull people over, search them, frisk them for weapons or do a breath test.

The graphics are as good at they need to be in this type of game.

The only criticism I have is that I wish the map was more varied and that there were more destinations to interact with.

Other than that I really like this game and will be downloading the upgrade very soon.

7/10

reviewText:
As a whole, this game has a lot of potential. I have enjoyed playing it so far and it is a good time passer. There are a few bugs (not to mention somewhat poor graphics) but overall the gameplay is fairly good. However I find that the off-duty life is somewhat boring, and I suggest to the developers that they add more features. Of course it is still in development so obviously it isn't complete but I am looking forward to see what new updates the developers have in store.

Rating: 6.5 out of 10

reviewText:
First off I am loving this game so far. Some really good ideas and has been well excuted for a game still in early development.

Here are some things I'd like to see implemented in the game.

-Have more variety of missions as you move up the ranks. As I've ranked up I am still getting the same menial tasks while on duty. I'd love to be able to do drug raids and busts as well look for clues at a murder scene etc.

-Have the option to choose a career track. Have the ability to choose whether to become a SWAT team member or Homicide Detective etc.

-Have more things to interact with and do while off duty. Have a bar or nightclub where the player can go for a drink to lower stress or even meet a partner to date and eventually move into your home.

-Have bigger houses to buy

-Have food places modelled indoors. This could work gameplay wise with robberies in progress happening inside the places or hostage negotiation situations.

-Fledge out the precinct indoors a bit more. As you rank up you get your own desk. You could also have a meeting room where the chief tells you about a wanted criminal to track down etc.

-More NPC variety. Once you pull them over and as you walk up to their car they could take off and start a pursuit. I also haven't encountered any of them who try to punch you, it's either they run away or draw a gun. There should be an inbetween.

-Add new items like pepper spray or baton you can use on unruly NPC's and Spike Strips for speeding cars who are dangerous.

The game is still in early development and I am sure the developers have a lot of plans for the game they want to implement. I am keen to see how this game pans out in the future :)

reviewText:
Not a bad game at all. Has its glitches here and there but nothing game breaking, just minor things that occure not too often. Has lower gaphics but that doesn't take from the game itself. Controls took a little getting used to but after about 15 minutes you pretty much get the hang of it.

I hope the developers will continue to add to this game, it has a lot of potential. Would love to see more regions perhaps as ways to pick where you want to work, like a bustling city instead of just the rural area, perhaps some more buildings to go into, even while on duty like stores, restaurants, ect. Kinda like how real officers do, who eat while on duty or patrol stores. More interaction with NPCs while off duty would be nice, such as building relationships or stopping in at a friends house and actually going to clubs or restaurants. Hopefully they are working on these or will consider it now it's been said.

But over all I give this game a 9/10 and a recommend.

reviewText:
Preemptive tl/dr; Nice concept, bad execution. Looking for realism? Don't buy. Looking for something like <Insert random word> Simulator 2014? Could give you some fun.

Got off the bus near my house in the middle of the night, it's raining and I've just got a shirt and hotpants on, should've planned that better. Got a squad car in my rather crappy yard, suppose it's my colleagues wanting to greet me. Turns out it isn't, it's my own personal squad car with a never ceasing stream of chatter through the comm radio. Nevermind, I better go to bed instead. I enter my house and I feel the sudden urge to charge through the living room at full speed, I must've looked like a malformed gorilla with my freakishly large arms waving about. Oh well, at least no one saw me, I'll go to sleep now, wake up fresh for my shift tomorrow.

I decide to take a cab to the station, seeing as I can't use the squad car in my yard. They all look funny at me when I arrive, I'm apparently not supposed to check in here at my shift, they tell me to just get changed back home and drive out, they'll assign me as I go. But they graciously enough let me check my e-mail on the computer and offer to sell me ammunition for 100 bucks. Seems kind of strange to me, at my previous assignment they equipped us with that kind of stuff for free. Oh well, note to self: Don't shoot too much.

Once again I call the cab to drive me home. I check my wardrobe and there it is! My uniform, a handgun, a sub-machine gun and a tazer. Ready for all eventualities. I go out and enter my car, start it up and tries to back out the entrance to my rather crappy yard. This car handles like a rhino, at least when backing. But at least it accelerates quickly, I went from 0-110km/h in like 2 seconds. No one really cares when I speed past red lights on the sidewalk in 110. The perks of being a cop.

First mission! Catch four speeders with the radar. Well that's ironic. Anyway, I drive out a bit away from town. If I should really call it town, more like a glorified block. I set up near a slope, that way they don't see me until it's too late. I go to get my radar and holey moley! There's tons of radars and cones in my car. I resist the urge to litter the entire area with radars and decide to just place two instead. That proves to be quite a difficult task though as the radar keeps falling over when I try to put it on the ground. After some effort and planning I manage to get a couple up anyway. A couple of people speed by, the radars automatically issues them a ticket, that's awesome tech. Suddenly this big freakin' truck comes wobbling across the road, I yell for him to stop the vehicle. He swerves into the side of my squad car and stops. I proceed to tell him to exit the vehicle and promptly does a breathalyzer test on him. He's clean. I'm pretty suspicious about the guy though so I ask for compliance, I frisk him and check his ID as well as the plates on the car. Nothing, he's clean, the truck is clean. Oh well, gotta let him go. It's not like I gotta pay the damage on my squad car by myself. Right?... Wrong. I call dispatch and they tell me to be more careful and charge me 600 bucks. I mean, c'mon.

As I walk back to my freshly repaired car, dispatch calls about a kidnapping. I'm so all over that. I get in my car, blaze my sirens and drive around aimlessly. Where am I supposed to go? I start asking people if they've seen anything suspect. No one has. Dispatch calls again, says they have a possible location. 10-4. As I watch my GPS I realize that when I switch the settings from mini-map" to "overview map"
date: the map is rotated so they don't look the same. Very unintuitive gear they assign here. Oh well
recommended: I manage to find my way at least. I get out my car and draw my gun
hoursPlayed: I feel my adrenaline pumping. In panic I realize I can't crouch with my gun drawn

I grab his gun from the ground and get back to stopping cars. There seems to be A LOT of drunk drivers here. One of them swerves right towards me

reviewText: The developers had a brilliant idea - let the player be a normal cop, usually taking care of small problems such as illeagaly parked cars, drunk drivers, sometimes getting some risky missions. Unfortunately, the idea is not followed by graphics - it's ok, but looks old - and sounds - which are quite.. poor? Also driving the car, in which you spend most of your day, is completely unrealistic; shooting is a bit too slow; there are not enough missions, everyday you do the same. The game is also full of smaller or larger technical issues, bugs etc. But you know what? I really enjoyed every minute of Enforcer. I really hope that the developers get rid of those problems and - with more money and time - the game might become perfect for those looking forward to playing any other role, than another criminal or special forces soldier.

reviewText: I think this game is fantastic. We've all wanted to, at some point, be a police officer, driving around town in our fast police cars with sirens and lights blaring, answering calls and getting bad guys. This game tries to fulfill that childhood dream and has done a darn good job at it. Now I know the graphics arent superb, but the game has plenty to offer. Dense customization of your car and house, 7 different police vehicles to date, and the ability to purchase a personal car that you can drive off-duty. You can also attempt to persuade criminals to surrender, taze them, or shoot them in the face with a pistol, a submachine gun, or a fully automatic assault rifle (3rd option is my go to). Also the map is quite large, and split up into several regions.\n\nIf I were to add/change anything in this game, it'd be as follows: have the ability to call for backup, because as of now you are the only officer in town. Also multiplayer would be nice, maybe even modes where you could play as a cop or a criminal. Also co-op, which would tie in with the calling for backup". Also I would like the mouse sensitivity inside your house to be the same as outdoors
date: because inside it is really hard to look/turn around. Also different siren sounds would be nice ( I discovered today that pressing F changes the siren to like a phazer :D)\n\nAnd that just about does it. Thanks for reading this review

reviewText:
It has the reasonable beginnings of a police sim, but there just is not enough depth. Managing your lifestyle is fairly straightforward and easy. The police work can be fun but it becomes repetitive pretty quick,

I feel this game would have been better if it touched on the psychological components a lot, lot more, with maybe even some Heavy Rain story choices.

Not enough depth to role play it, not enough variation to be enjoyable in an 'arcade' sense, and not enough flexibility to have fun in a 'Sims' type sense. It has potential, but not worth the pruchase at this stage.

reviewText:
Short: So, this game has a lot of promise but it's very rough around the edges. On sale for $10 it's an acceptable asking price, anything further is a rip-off.

Long: I mean the basic concept of the game is pretty fun. Unfortunately sooner or later it becomes repeditive or worse. It took me about 14 hours of play time to rank up from level 1 (Officer) to level 15 (Chief of Police). The levels don't really do anything as a far as I can tell, since you are a lone police officer with no backup. As far as ticketing and arrests of daily street crime, this game has got it. Anything else, not implemented. This game would probably benefit from multiplayer and some bug fixes but I don't see that happening. The developer himself stated they are a small studio and originally, they didn't even plan to update this. They did release a few updates because of the amount of interest there is, but if you buy this you should expect that you are purchasing a run-down game. I mean, it's good to kill time, but further then that there is just simply not much to do.

This game also features an off-duty side, but it's really poorly implemented and boring to do. I usually slept for 6 hours, watched TV 3-5 times and was already to go on duty again. It's really passable and more of an inconvience then anything more.

reviewText:
I love this game because you can finally be a police officer. You, the only cop in town, have the authority and people listen to you! While you do the normal missions, dispatch can call you for various emergencies. YOU HAVE TO SLEEP AT LEAST 8 HOURS EACH NIGHT IN ORDER FOR THEM TO KEEP CALLING! Taking two gunshots can get you killed, so gunfights are especially nerve-wracking. Sometimes if you pull over a person and they run, you have to draw your tazer and press C to make them stop.

There are also realism factors like turn signals, the warning horn, and others. You have to shut off your engine to exit the car, but once you reach 12mph or lower you can press R, the car will stop, and you get out.

Love this game and love that the Devs are still working on it!

reviewText: I think this game is fantastic. We've all wanted to, at some point, be a police officer, driving around town in our fast police cars with sirens and lights blaring, answering calls and getting bad guys. This game tries to fulfill that childhood dream and has done a darn good job at it. Now I know the graphics arent superb, but the game has plenty to offer. Dense customization of your car and house, 7 different police vehicles to date, and the ability to purchase a personal car that you can drive off-duty. You can also attempt to persuade criminals to surrender, taze them, or shoot them in the face with a pistol, a submachine gun, or a fully automatic assault rifle (3rd option is my go to). Also the map is quite large, and split up into several regions.\n\nIf I were to add/change anything in this game, it'd be as follows: have the ability to call for backup, because as of now you are the only officer in town. Also multiplayer would be nice, maybe even modes where you could play as a cop or a criminal. Also co-op, which would tie in with the calling for backup". Also I would like the mouse sensitivity inside your house to be the same as outdoors
date: because inside it is really hard to look/turn around. Also different siren sounds would be nice ( I discovered today that pressing F changes the siren to like a phazer :D)\n\nAnd that just about does it. Thanks for reading this review

reviewText:
I'm a fan of police work, I slightly want to be a cop. But as much as I like this game and it's aspects, it is a gigantic mess. Awkward animations, bad voicework, terrible car physics, and to top it all off: It has the graphical quality of a 2002 game.

I WANT to love this game, but I cannot look past all the bugs, sillyness and missed potential!
There is a list of things in the forums that people want in this game, but I don't think the devs are up to the challenge....

6/10 Play with no intention of being an actual police officer, play like a Los Santos cop. COPCAR-SMASH!
