reviewText: not a terrible game, I appreciate it is quite realistic ( despite skipping cutscenes where the tow truck tows the cars away, or the police van takes the criminals away ) and replacing them with 2-3 second black screens. As well, vehicle handling, in my opinion is nearly impossible. 0-150 KM/H in 3 seconds? and slowing down.... good luck braking from 150, because when you do, you will lose control of your vehicle, and likely hit a few cars, damaging your police car, forcing you to waste your earned in-game money, and losing score to call a tow truck to fix your car that was damaged beyond believe upon hitting a no parking sign. Until this update comes out, that was promised mid-July, but no notice has been given as to why, in early August, there is still no update. Unless the update covers the biggest issues I can find in this game, such as vehicle handling, ( which also makes it impossible to get into a good position to arrest drug dealers ) this game is lacking. As well, I have seen a few bugs so far, such as people walking over my police car ( yes, they litterally jump up, walk over the roof, down onto the hood, and keep talking on their cell-phones like nothing happened ) or stuck spinning around behind some vehicle they constantly keep walking into. You have alot of work to do devs, and if you ever manage to release the much-awaited, and promised update, I will be happy to revise my review. But until then, I do not recommend this game.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
The game is actually very entertaining. You just have to go into it with an open mind that it is still in the works, otherwise all the bugs will irritate you. As of now, everything is pretty routine.  As of now, it's like a mobile game, in the respect that it is just sort of a time killer. Not something you will spend all day playing, but it is fun for a few hours.

If you like 3rd person games, and a police simulator that is actually pretty in-depth, I do suggest picking this up. Hopefully, it can only get better. They have already patched some irritating issues, like the invisible jumps in the middle of the road that send you into the sky for a meet and greet with jesus christ himself.

What can you do?

1.) Stop cars and check registration / Administer breathalizer
2.) Use NYC's stop and frisk policy on random people walking
3.) Wait for a call for a suspected murderer, vandalizer, thief, or assault.
4.) Set up a radar and sit back collecting 30pts per speeder.
5.) Go home, pay $5 to your fridge to eat, take a shower, watch tv, go to sleep.
6.) Rank up with points, which unlocks free new cruisers. (Better top speeds.... Goodluck staying on road and stopping.)

The main bugs that hurt are:

The randomly disappearing objects, such as a person you are in a foot chase with, or a car that you are attempting to stop. (Mainly because it gets out of range when you try to turn around your charger that steers like a battle tanker)

Random gun jams on your weapon. The gun sometimes just doesn't fire, which leaves you clicking fast and sometimes unloading a full magazine into somoenes face.

You cannot relieve stress fast enough. If you try to go out with friends and good ol mom in one day, you get penalized for being off duty too long. And a shower only gives VERY little relief.

Cars can, and will run into you. Not that it hurts you, as your officer is Bruce Lee, and will ninja jump to the top on the car.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: I usually don't vote no on recommendation for games, but I feel I should for this one. It's not that it's just completely horrible, it's not. However, the game controls are really hard to use and the movement/action of the character is not smooth by any twist of the word. I just find it so aggravating and tiresome trying to play this game because my character ends up doing things I don't want him to do or I can't figure out how to do something.\n\nOn the flip, the idea behind the game is good. I like the police simulation theme and a lot of the ideas behind traffic stops, speed traps, responding to calls, etc. is really cool. But when I spend the whole (in-game) day trying to do only one of those, the game needs some work. I'm sure if you put enough time and effort into this game, you may get good at it and might actually enjoy it but the learning curve is crazy with this game. I'm sorry but I don't recommed this game.

reviewText:
Unfortunately, as many others have said this had great potential but the final product is a shoddy, buggy and under-developed mess.

Make no mistake, I am the first to recognise this is an Indie game, from a studio that isn't well known-- but I feel as if they've been too ambitious, knowing their ability/limits as a small team. I would've much rather had a smaller, but thoroughly polished game-- than this which tries to do everything but there's such a lack of detail into some of the ideas that have been implemented that it ruins the game.

Also, the updates which were promised months ago, still  haven't come. I wouldnt' hold any hope out for this game getting updated, or getting any more content/refined features, it's sadly another early access job gone down the toilet.

reviewText:
I used to think that this game had a lot of potential when the game was released, back when the developers still cared about improving the game's entertainment and simulation aspect.

Since early 2015, the game hasn't really received updates that would make the game less buggy and add more realism. Right now, with the type of care that the developers are putting into Enforcer, they are currently all talk but no walk. They promise then postpone repetitively an update that was scheduled for July 2015, the update was supposed to have small extra features. Three months later and still no word on the update's release date or progress. Then the developers even admitted they have no ETA on the update.

People shouldn't expect this game to be a simulation; there are a lot of realistic features that aren't included, which makes the game very repetitive.

reviewText:
The game is actually very entertaining. You just have to go into it with an open mind that it is still in the works, otherwise all the bugs will irritate you. As of now, everything is pretty routine.  As of now, it's like a mobile game, in the respect that it is just sort of a time killer. Not something you will spend all day playing, but it is fun for a few hours.

If you like 3rd person games, and a police simulator that is actually pretty in-depth, I do suggest picking this up. Hopefully, it can only get better. They have already patched some irritating issues, like the invisible jumps in the middle of the road that send you into the sky for a meet and greet with jesus christ himself.

What can you do?

1.) Stop cars and check registration / Administer breathalizer
2.) Use NYC's stop and frisk policy on random people walking
3.) Wait for a call for a suspected murderer, vandalizer, thief, or assault.
4.) Set up a radar and sit back collecting 30pts per speeder.
5.) Go home, pay $5 to your fridge to eat, take a shower, watch tv, go to sleep.
6.) Rank up with points, which unlocks free new cruisers. (Better top speeds.... Goodluck staying on road and stopping.)

The main bugs that hurt are:

The randomly disappearing objects, such as a person you are in a foot chase with, or a car that you are attempting to stop. (Mainly because it gets out of range when you try to turn around your charger that steers like a battle tanker)

Random gun jams on your weapon. The gun sometimes just doesn't fire, which leaves you clicking fast and sometimes unloading a full magazine into somoenes face.

You cannot relieve stress fast enough. If you try to go out with friends and good ol mom in one day, you get penalized for being off duty too long. And a shower only gives VERY little relief.

Cars can, and will run into you. Not that it hurts you, as your officer is Bruce Lee, and will ninja jump to the top on the car.

reviewText:
As current law enforcement I can say that this game is decently close.. But still has room to expand.

Positives:

Decent Roleplay
Easy controls/Xbox 360 controller compatibility
Customizeable vehicles
Interesting scenarios, from traffic stops to drug busts
Large map with varrying terrain/environments

Negatives:

Graphics are a little behind the times, and some animations become flawed. The former is tolerable, but the latter could use minor work.

Load points are.. Obvious, a bit to obvious. You can see their green glow from far across the cell. Other than visually unappealing, they function well.

Perpetrators tend to have three modes, shoot, run, or surrender. When they shoot, it's tolerable, and requires some fast thinking. When they run, there is an issue.. You character can't run as fast as the AI, so being away from your vehicle on foot chases always fail unless you can get them to surrender quickly. When they surrender, there are some arrest issues. Such as when you go code 3 because someone blows through a blockade, pointing a tazer at them costs points. Other times they work fine.

Cars/people are unvaried. There are a couple several models for both, different clothings, skin colors, car colors, and issues with the cars. However, increased detail, in-depth conversations, random generated rap sheets and more models and even clothing would make the depth and roleplay value tenfold.

Physics is... Simple. In Enforcer. Gravity seems to be low. The impact of wrecks causes more of an ice-skating situation. And punching the breaks at high speed causes some interesting/unrealistic sliding. Also, don't worry about running over civilians, they will levitate over your vehicle. And sometimes even run over the top.

Vehicle specs/damage could be refined heavily. I have drove a P-71 Highway Inteceptor for a few years. The top speed is not 70mph, it is more in line of 140mph (With the govenor, it's more like 120). All vehicles need the physics refined, and the specs adjusted. The damage to the vehicles could be more specific. Such as flat-tires, optional upgrades for tires, bumpers, lights, ect..

No fires. Ever. Which is disappointing. Happening upon a field fire would be nice. At least to report.

You and the dispatcher are the only directly interactable public service. Other police vehicles/paramedics/tows and ect would be nice. Being able to call backup, or to see another officer pulling over speeders would be cool.

Certian situations are cause for arresting someone. There are occassional bugs where someone shooting you will get you punished if you fire at, or arrest them.

More/better houses could be added, upgrades and all that.

More weapons/outfits/character customization would be nice. Actual vendors/shops and inventory would be cool.

Instead of taking perps directly to the 200sqft police station/jail you should take them to a penetentary.

Traffic lights and laws for AI needs repaired/overhauled.


... I can't think of any more things right now, but I am sure to renew and revise this opinion as the game developes. I would very much like to hear from the developers about my views/opinions.

All in all.. This game is well worth the price. It is good. It has potental. If you like law enforcement rp, buy it. :)

reviewText:
I took a chance on this game despite the mixed reviews and was disappointed with the result. This game really should be on as early access because it is far from what I would expect from a completed project. The AI is poorly coded, for example I parked at the roadside to set up a speed camera and within seconds 6 npcs were walking continuously against the boot/trunk of my car going nowhere.

When you arrest someone they magically teleport to you as you lead them back to your car and if you stand still they start to circle you like a derpy shark. There's no tutorial to explain how anything works (probably because most of it is broken).

The vehicle handling is laughable and the lack of softbody physics is brought sharply into focus when you crash into a lamp post only to come to an instant halt.

The camera clips through walls and gets stuck on the outside of the car garage when you drive inside.

There's an unacceptable number of bugs and poorly delivered gameplay elements here that leaves me astounded that the developer would honestly believe that this was ready to move into beta never mind a full release.

DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! Hang on for Police 10-13" it looks like it could be a great game and more importantly the devs are active with their community.

0/10

"

reviewText:
Unfortunately, as many others have said this had great potential but the final product is a shoddy, buggy and under-developed mess.

Make no mistake, I am the first to recognise this is an Indie game, from a studio that isn't well known-- but I feel as if they've been too ambitious, knowing their ability/limits as a small team. I would've much rather had a smaller, but thoroughly polished game-- than this which tries to do everything but there's such a lack of detail into some of the ideas that have been implemented that it ruins the game.

Also, the updates which were promised months ago, still  haven't come. I wouldnt' hold any hope out for this game getting updated, or getting any more content/refined features, it's sadly another early access job gone down the toilet.

reviewText: not a terrible game, I appreciate it is quite realistic ( despite skipping cutscenes where the tow truck tows the cars away, or the police van takes the criminals away ) and replacing them with 2-3 second black screens. As well, vehicle handling, in my opinion is nearly impossible. 0-150 KM/H in 3 seconds? and slowing down.... good luck braking from 150, because when you do, you will lose control of your vehicle, and likely hit a few cars, damaging your police car, forcing you to waste your earned in-game money, and losing score to call a tow truck to fix your car that was damaged beyond believe upon hitting a no parking sign. Until this update comes out, that was promised mid-July, but no notice has been given as to why, in early August, there is still no update. Unless the update covers the biggest issues I can find in this game, such as vehicle handling, ( which also makes it impossible to get into a good position to arrest drug dealers ) this game is lacking. As well, I have seen a few bugs so far, such as people walking over my police car ( yes, they litterally jump up, walk over the roof, down onto the hood, and keep talking on their cell-phones like nothing happened ) or stuck spinning around behind some vehicle they constantly keep walking into. You have alot of work to do devs, and if you ever manage to release the much-awaited, and promised update, I will be happy to revise my review. But until then, I do not recommend this game.

reviewText:
I took a chance on this game despite the mixed reviews and was disappointed with the result. This game really should be on as early access because it is far from what I would expect from a completed project. The AI is poorly coded, for example I parked at the roadside to set up a speed camera and within seconds 6 npcs were walking continuously against the boot/trunk of my car going nowhere.

When you arrest someone they magically teleport to you as you lead them back to your car and if you stand still they start to circle you like a derpy shark. There's no tutorial to explain how anything works (probably because most of it is broken).

The vehicle handling is laughable and the lack of softbody physics is brought sharply into focus when you crash into a lamp post only to come to an instant halt.

The camera clips through walls and gets stuck on the outside of the car garage when you drive inside.

There's an unacceptable number of bugs and poorly delivered gameplay elements here that leaves me astounded that the developer would honestly believe that this was ready to move into beta never mind a full release.

DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! Hang on for Police 10-13" it looks like it could be a great game and more importantly the devs are active with their community.

0/10

"

date: it says "4+h" when it should say +4h. Moreover
recommended: in a some places the developer has forgotten to add a "s" on the end of words.\n\nAnother issue is that the car picks up speed quite quickly making handeling difficult. Moreover
hoursPlayed:
the speed on the roads need to be increased. On long back roads the speed should be 50 or 60 MPH and not 30 MPH. This gets annoying when the NPC drive really slowly and you are stuck behind them...

I am also having an isssue in the car customization and when I change to get on duty where the screen just freezes or I cannot move. I don't know if this is a problem on my side.

Right now I just pull over random cars and find many things wrong with them without me even knowing. For example a car looks fine but when my officer goes to speak to them there registration plates are illegal or their brake lights don't work or they are drunk

reviewText:
I'm a fan of police work, I slightly want to be a cop. But as much as I like this game and it's aspects, it is a gigantic mess. Awkward animations, bad voicework, terrible car physics, and to top it all off: It has the graphical quality of a 2002 game.

I WANT to love this game, but I cannot look past all the bugs, sillyness and missed potential!
There is a list of things in the forums that people want in this game, but I don't think the devs are up to the challenge....

6/10 Play with no intention of being an actual police officer, play like a Los Santos cop. COPCAR-SMASH!
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Enforcer: Police, Crime, Action is an overal ok game to have in your library.  Being single player it is nice to have to pass the time with when you get burnt out on other games.

PROs:
Semi-moddable.  You cannot bring in custom models (that I have seen anyways), however you can cusomize vehicle skins, player skins and just about an other graphic, sound, or text file in the game if you know what you are doing.

CONs:
Single player only, inconsistant vehicle handling, AI don't always cooperate.

I have over 270 hours on Enforcer: Police, Crime, Action.  One of my favorite things to do is create custom textures for the vehicles.  I have found that the models are not the best for doing this but you get used to the quirks the more textures you make.

I also enjoy just hopping on and doing a quick tour of duty when I need a break from website work or other games such as GTA.  Although this is not a AAA game I would still recommend to anyone that wants something small that can be used as a decent way to take a break from it all.

reviewText:
So, when I saw this game, I thought it was going to be like Police Quest and be a police sim with some kind of accuracy about it.

However, it's a good deal more like GTA from the police perspective.

Honestly, I think the thing that throws me off the most is the dialog.  A lot of what's said from dispatch, or the written text, is odd and strikes me as non-English speakers who've never watched Cops trying to write dialog.  I would expect less There's a murderer on the loose" and more "Shots fired; civilian casualties" or "Armed suspect reported" or the like.  Google searches reveal that the dialog used to be even worse
date: so this is *after improvement*.\n\nThere isn't much polish; the little things will constantly eat at you.  Like

hoursPlayed: or having it slide backwards down a hill when it's parked (which I guess is fixed in the latest patch).  You basically harass and pull over random people to try and make your quotas

reviewText:
This Game gets  10/10 for the Idea, but 2/10 for the execution,

Pros:
- Play On and Off Duty
- You can buy stuff for your house
- You get Hungry and thirsty + Car Fuel consumption
- You can set speed traps pull and arrest whoever you like
- Customize your car
- Several zones to patrol in


Cons:
- Bad graphics
- Bad Pysx
- Clunky movment and weapon Handling



I think if the devs kept the current ideas, moved to Unreal 4 Engine and worked on the game more this would be a greast police simulator

If you don't mind the Cons then go for it its fun to play !

reviewText:
Unfortunately, as many others have said this had great potential but the final product is a shoddy, buggy and under-developed mess.

Make no mistake, I am the first to recognise this is an Indie game, from a studio that isn't well known-- but I feel as if they've been too ambitious, knowing their ability/limits as a small team. I would've much rather had a smaller, but thoroughly polished game-- than this which tries to do everything but there's such a lack of detail into some of the ideas that have been implemented that it ruins the game.

Also, the updates which were promised months ago, still  haven't come. I wouldnt' hold any hope out for this game getting updated, or getting any more content/refined features, it's sadly another early access job gone down the toilet.

reviewText: I usually don't vote no on recommendation for games, but I feel I should for this one. It's not that it's just completely horrible, it's not. However, the game controls are really hard to use and the movement/action of the character is not smooth by any twist of the word. I just find it so aggravating and tiresome trying to play this game because my character ends up doing things I don't want him to do or I can't figure out how to do something.\n\nOn the flip, the idea behind the game is good. I like the police simulation theme and a lot of the ideas behind traffic stops, speed traps, responding to calls, etc. is really cool. But when I spend the whole (in-game) day trying to do only one of those, the game needs some work. I'm sure if you put enough time and effort into this game, you may get good at it and might actually enjoy it but the learning curve is crazy with this game. I'm sorry but I don't recommed this game.

reviewText: There are a lot of bugs out of the gate, which I can look past seeing as Enforcer" is this studios first foray into PC gaming (I believe they only did mobile games up until this point).\n\nI've seen a few complaints about the graphics
date: they aren't great but thats not a big deal to me. My opinion is that good graphics does not always equal a good game. Check out the community hub for a more complete list of the current bugs which Odin is currently working on fixing.\n\nAnyway
hoursPlayed: I have actually been able to have fun with this game. I like it and I recommend it (while its cheap) to anyone who likes games where they can roleplay a police officer. It's not the greatest game in the world right now but it should provide you some entertainment and that is worth the $15. Plus I am of the opinion that it will get great with some time
voteText: hopefully I don't get proven wrong.\n\n*UPDATE= After several months of broken
votesHelpful: I can no longer endorse this game. It was a rough start and the developer was actually working to try and fix this mess for a time
votesTotal: now it appears they have slowed or stopped development. There is an update they announced in October that never got released. I think this game was too ambitious for them."

reviewText: I loved the idea and vision for this game and wanted to support them to make a game that would give us something different for a change. However, I have never managed to play this game for very long. It is very buggy, unstable and contains unfinished and outright missing features. This is more like a prototype then an actual game. Overall This game is just not that great. The Developer seems dishonest and full of false promises. The fact it is still retailing at £14.99 is laughable, Steam would do well to remove it and refund those that have purchased it.

reviewText:
I would pay $5 for this game, like maybe.

Pros

Fun game to keep you busy for a few hours.

Kind of sums up the job of police officers and what they do.

Score to show how good of a job you are doing and when you will rank up.

Cons (Where do I begin?)

Crummy Animations.

Citizens have no rights.

Cars are very poorly animated. (Crash animations, etc.)

Very little plot/story.

The game is just being a police officer.

Developers seem to have not put alot of attention in this game.

Gets boring quickly.

Consistent grinding of doing the same thing to get somewhere. (Ex. Road Block, Frisking, etc.)

Awful Combat. (Gun animations, Death animations, Impairment animations (Taser,Stun Gun))

Dialogue is awful.

Only 2 Suits.

reviewText: I bought this game when it was first released. Simply put, the graphics were so bad, I thought my computer was tripping because it has a great graphics card. But no, it looks like it was made in 2000 and looks outdated. The towns don't have alot of detail, the cars handling is way off balanced, and overall, I'd rather play LSPDFR since it's actually more than decent even thought it's a mod for GTA V. It doesn't look like the developers care and only made the game for a quick buck. I don't recommend this game to anyone,

reviewText:
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME !

I know that this game seems like a very good idea and is probably the only and first Police simulator on steam, but it doesn't feel like it is shown in screenshots and videos.

The game has a ridiculously high amount of bugs.

Your car drives in a very uncomfortably unrealistic way, speed acceleration is terrible and makes you crash in to buildings nearly all 2 seconds.

Some cars will just hang in the air or turn around somehow.

People run away in a non-human speed, so you are hardly able to catch them

Emergency-calls are nearly always the same.

People seem to be able to shot at you, but you are not able to shot at them, if you do so, you get a penalty.

These were just from scratch, there are around more than 100- 200 bugs and flaws left, but you might throw a look in to the steam forums of this game.

When I started, I thought. Well, at least devs are fixing it. But then I found out that there is only ONE developers working on this game who tells his community about a year to release a proper update, but still..there has been updates but they did not fix any of the issues. When you try to ask for help about specific issues or try to discuss them with other players, your thread gets locked or even removed immediately.

This game is probably the biggest waste of money. I never was as frustrated paying money for a game like for this one.
Besides that, the price is ridiculously high. £ 15.00 is just way too much. To even buy this game for £ 1 or £ 2 you probably have to be very drunk or on acid.

Highly NOT recommended. Do not buy this game and do not make the same mistake as thousands of others who wasted money on this  game ".

"

reviewText: There are a lot of things I like about this game, and of course quite a few things that could be improved - but overall - it's kept me entertained.  I'd like to see a little more variety in tasks. It'd be good to iron out a few little visual bugs - like when someone gets out of a vehicle - there's still someone sitting inside, or when you tell someone they're free to go, and they still stand there gormlessly. An auto-rest option would be good - as it's pretty repetitive at the end of a shift to have to go home and watch the tv 4 times. The directing traffic option does nothing other than make you look silly.\n\nIt's a good base game - has a lot of positives going for it - but if ever there's a version 2 - could do with a lot of improvement. If you just like the idea of cruising around in a police car issuing tickets and catching drunks, it'll keep you happy.
